channel.title: AI on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in AI on FinanClub

item.title: UPST
item.description: score:134 Chances: WILMINGTON, Ohio & SAN MATEO, Calif., March 21, 2024–Liberty Savings Bank Selects Upstart for Personal Lending There are seven disruptive stocks that should be on every investor’s radar. These companies are pioneering innovative technologies and business models that have the potential to change traditional industries and create massive new markets.

item.title: W
item.description: score:112 Chances: Wayfair stock reached an important technical milestone, seeing its Relative Strength (RS) Rating jump into the 80-plus percentile with an improvement to 83, up from 78 the day before. The prospect of price stabilization and cheaper credit is positive for consumers, as are the current low rate of unemployment and recent improvements in real wage growth.

item.title: META
item.description: score:159 Chances: Strong short interest in Truth Social suggests a gloomy view of its future. Wall Street investors are particularly bullish on tech as AI transforms many companies’ operations. Meta Platforms, Inc. is introducing new Instagram policies which could impact political content. Meta’s Oversight Board has recommended changes to the handling of the Arabic term ‘shaheed’, potentially affecting the company’s content moderation practices.

item.title: PLTR
item.description: score:-182 Chances: Palantir is expected to rapidly expand earnings per share over several years. The company is taking a visionary leap The path could be wide open for Palantir stock to climb even higher from here on out. Risks: Will generative artificial intelligence boost Palantir stock in the commercial market amid slowing revenue growth for the company?

item.title: ARM
item.description: score:49 Chances: Semiconductor valuations remain expensive even after selloff Nvidia has become the undisputed leader in a stock market powered by AI hopes Shares of Asian chip makers rose after strong earnings from Nvidia Intel unveiled its Intel Foundry services in the AI landscape Smaller players catching the AI wave Risks: Valuations are lofty for the chip maker and other tech giants, signaling a possible bubble Investors may be forgetting basic principles of investing to chase hot AI stocks Fear of missing out in the stock market rally may lead to irrational investment decisions Score:49 chances characters count - risks characters count = 49

item.title: IBM
item.description: score:-20 Chances: IBM closed positively at $193.34, showing potential for growth in the near future. IBM has been paying close attention to by Zacks.com users, indicating investor interest in the stock. Risks: The company has undergone significant changes and may not be the same as it used to be, posing potential risks for investors.

item.title: ZM
item.description: score:199 Chances: Zoom Video reported Q4 earnings and revenue that topped estimates amid strength in the enterprise market. Shares of video conferencing platform Zoom (NASDAQ:ZM) jumped 13.5% in the pre-market session after the company reported fourth-quarter results, with its revenue narrowly outperforming Wall Street’s estimates, though EPS beat by a more convincing margin.

item.title: SNOW
item.description: score:-363 Chances: Long-term AI tailwinds could turn $2,000 and some patience into big-time returns. Certain Wall Street analysts see substantial upside for Snowflake and Sea Limited shareholders. The trend toward cloud optimization is beginning to wane. Snowflake’s growth potential comes from an ever increasing need to store and analyze larger amounts of data securely.

item.title: CSCO
item.description: score:22 Chances: Cisco Systems (CSCO) settling at $52.24, representing a -0.1% change from its previous close. Cisco, Microsoft Corp. and Samsung Electronics announced new meeting room solutions for enhanced collaboration experiences. Cisco released its 2024 Data Privacy Benchmark Study, highlighting growing privacy concerns and trust challenges with AI.

item.title: HPQ
item.description: score:13 Chances: Businesses’ and consumers’ access to AI — without having to go through the cloud — is about to change, says HP CEO Enrique Lores. The advent of AI-powered PCs has the focus of many on Wall Street as the AI race enters its second lap in 2024.
